availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Mayfield Graves County Ky.
September 3d 1863
To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky
Be it known-

That on the 17th day of August 1863 Thomas Carman a Justice of the Peace in district No. 8 in Graves County presented in open Court in writing his Resignation which was ordered to be filed and the same certified to the Governor of Kentucky, & praying the appointment of H. L. Anderson to fill the vacancy occassioned by the Resignation of said Carman

Attest J. T. Bolinger Clerk G. C. C.
By J. H. Robbins D. C.

H L. Anderson is a true Union man of the "men & money" stripe who Received the entire union vote of his District in opposition to Thos. Carman at the last Election
Graves Co
certft.
J. Peace
8th Sept 1863
Not granted upon grounds that the proper certificate of resignation has not been received
